1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (03:25): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: The 'strong' arguments were based on fairness.  The remove-Microdata crowd has rebuked that very line of argument pretty thoroughly.

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (03:26): It would look pretty silly to come back and say they really meant it was a good argument.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (03:27): (It wasn't, but it was better than what's there now.)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (03:27): No, someone else I mean. "Those people hate microdata, but there are some of us who really believe in fairness and such..."
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (03:28): Sure.  It's still a crap argument.  Technologies don't succeed or fail based on fairness.
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (03:28): Fair enough (pun noticed)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (03:30): didn't intend to be punny. ?_?
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (03:30): Oh, the pun was that fairness being irrelevant was "fair enough"

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (03:59): And then 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 and I have been seriously discussing aligning CSS and SVG's notions of gradients, so it's possible that further changes may arrive in the near future.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (03:59): (We should see something about that on the www-style list soon.)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:59): cool
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:05): finds CSS WG issue 179 (Add SVG equivalents to gradients proposal.)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:06): how are things?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:06): good good
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:06): one thing I wanted to ask you about is if SVG filters have been flipped on in nightlies yet
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:08): plus I found a crasher - https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=32357
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:10): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: filters are on in trunk - I don't know if they have made it to a nightly yet
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:10): thanks for reporting the crasher
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (04:18): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: Yeah, issue 179 is actually impossible!  Turns out that several of the radial gradients can't be reproduced in SVG.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:18): interesting
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (04:19): Yeah, which is why we're planning on aligning our abstractions so that we can express the same things using roughly the same concepts.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:19): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: well, kind of a bummer to hear that
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:19): (I meant bummer to hear that they can't be reproduced)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (04:20): Eh, it just means that we need to lift SVG a bit, because I think the cases that it's not hitting are useful.

227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (04:23): yeah, I think there is a pretty easy way to make SVG versions of most of the gradients, but some of them are not really possible in the general case... should be easy to add them to SVG... I am not sure I like some of the CSS syntax, but that's relatively unimportant
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (04:24): specifically, SVG doesn't allow the author to explicitly declare whether the radial gradient is elliptical or circular
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (04:25): (though it's possible to get both results)

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (04:29): That latter part is due to SVG having a slightly crazy notion of image servers that isn't sufficiently developed and general, while CSS doesn't have such an idea at all and has so far relied on url() images all working basically the same.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (04:30): I want to both generalize SVG's image-server concept, and upgrade CSS to also use it.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (04:33): Also: omg I'm stopping reading all the issue-76 threads.  They are entirely uninteresting.  >_<
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (04:33): Also: now I need to go write a change proposal for that one dt/dd issue.  Not a counter-proposal, at least.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (04:39): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: thanks for updating your Change Proposal

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (04:40): np.  There are several points that Manu specifically rebutted in my change proposal, and while I'd like to re-rebut them, I don't believe they're actually relevant to the proposal, so I left the mout.
